New Records: Boston Celtics set a single-game franchise record and tied the all-time NBA high with 29 made threes in a 132-109 victory.
Key Match Events: Boston Celtics' starting five went 26-for-41 on 3-pointers (63.4%).
Jayson Tatum went 8-for-11 on threes as part of a superb 37-point, 10-assist performance.
Derrick White and Jaylen Brown were 6-of-10 and 5-of-9, finishing with 24 and 23 points, respectively.
Pre-Game Insights: The Celtics took head coach Joe Mazzulla’s preference for threes over twos to a new extreme as they began their title defense.
Knicks head coach Tom Thibodeau traded five first-round draft picks for Mikal Bridges to beef up their wing defense.
Post-Match Reflections: Knicks head coach Tom Thibodeau: 'Mathematically, it’s going to be hard to win that game.'
Josh Hart: 'You’ve got to give them credit, man. They’re already an explosive team, and obviously there was energy in the arena today that was contagious.'
Miscellaneous Highlights: Boston Celtics' starters hit 60.4% of their 3-pointers in the first half.
The Knicks' starters were 4-for-17 from beyond the arc.
Knicks' Mikal Bridges defended every Boston starter and allowed them to make six of seven 3-pointers.
